meanings.definition: A subfamily of topminnows, ray-finned fish in the family Fundulidae.
meanings.english_definition: A taxonomic subfamily within the family Fundulidae – the topminnows.

etymology.value: From Fundulus (the genus name) + -inae (a standard suffix used to form the names of subfamilies in zoological nomenclature).

usage_notes.explanation: In taxonomy, the name Fundulinae is used to classify a specific group of topminnows within the larger family Fundulidae.

readability_explanation.text: This term is highly technical and specific to the field of zoology, particularly ichthyology (the study of fish). It would not be commonly encountered outside of scientific literature or discussions among experts in this field.
